titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Peirce family papers, 1856-1873
titlepage.publisher:
Department of Special Collections and University Archives
Stanford University Libraries
Stanford, California
titlepage.p: © 1999 The Board of Trustees of Stanford University. All rights reserved.

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: Stanford University. Libraries. Dept. of Special Collections and University Archives.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: Property rights reside with the repository. Literary rights reside with the creators of the documents or their heirs. To obtain permission to publish or reproduce, please contact the Public Services Librarian of the Dept. of Special Collections.

userestrict.head: Restrictive Clause
userestrict.p: All the Peirce Family Papers donated by Miss Rosamond Peirce, Mrs. Forrest J. Kincade and Mrs. Carolyn Peirce Brown, are open for inspection and research with the following limitations:

blockquote.p: 1. Publication rights are reserved by the donors to themselves or persons designated by them, and to the children of Carolyn P. Brown (Elizabeth Brown Gordon, James P. Brown, and Peter H. Brown) during the life-times of the donors and for five years after the death of the last surviving donor.
2. Photocopies may only be made with the written permission of the donors or any one of the donors acting for all of the donors.
3. Short quotations not related to George H. Peirce, his immediate family, or his career in Manila, may be published without permission of the donors at the discretion of the Manuscripts Librarian.

userestrict.p: Notice of the above restrictions will appear on the patron use form for the researchers wishing to use this collection. The patron's signature on that form indicates agreement to adhere to these conditions.

custodhist.head: Provenance
custodhist.p: Gift of Mrs. Carolyn P. Brown, Miss Rosamund Peirce, and Mrs. Forrest J. Kincade, 1970.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: [Identification of item] Peirce family papers, M0202, Dept. of Special Collections, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

odd.head: KEY
odd.p: The numbers in parentheses immediately following each name indicate the number of letters in the folder. The dates which follow indicate the earliest and latest item in the folder, but do not necessarily indicate an item from each intervening year. All folders are arranged in chronological order.

If the entry does not indicate to whom the items were sent, all letters in the folder were addressed to George H. Peirce (1837 - 1874). Any other recipients are indicated. The following abbreviations are used:

item.expan: Lydia Ellen Eaton Peirce (1839-1903), wife of George H. Peirce.
George H. Peirce (1837-1874), used only when other recipients also in folder.

did.unittitle: Unidentified. (20) Includes one letter from Lydia Eaton Pierce's Aunt Margie.

Arnold, S. E. (1) Sept. 5, to Mrs. EMP.
Bigelow, Alanson. (4) 1882 - 1883,to Eliza P. and Mrs. EMP.

Byron, Lotta R. (1) April 30, 1896,to Mrs. GHP.
Eaton, Emily Craft and Percival. (1) 1892,to Mrs. GHP.
Hobart, David Kimball. (33) 1856 - 1861. Oct. 30, 1860note with letter by John J. French enclosed.
Howell, Mrs. George F. (1) 1895,to Mrs. GHP.
Hoyt, Mrs. A. M. (1) August 25,to Mrs. GHP.
Huntington, C. L. (1) n.d.,to Mrs. EMP.

Manning, Anna R. (1) n.d.,to Mrs. GHP.
Mitchell, Nathaniel. I. Correspondence to GHP, (75) 1857 - 1868.
II. - IV. General business papers, including accounts, miscellaneous correspindence, stock certificates, promissory notes, legal papers.
VI. Dorrance, Oliver B., dealings with.
VIII. Loring, David W., dealings with.
Nicholson, Charles W. (2) 1872,to Ogden E. Edwards.
Palmer, Hattie (Mrs. Charles Ray). (1) 1892,to Mrs. GHP.
Peirce, Caroline P. (3) 1868 - 1874,to, Mr. and Mrs. GHP.
Peirce, Eliza Mitchell (Mrs. EMP). (1) n.d.,to Mr. and Mrs. GHP.
Peirce, Eliza. (sister of GHP). (33) 1850 - 1880,to Mrs. EMP and Emily P.
Peirce, Emily Mitchell. (c. 75) Written from Europe to Mrs. EMP and Eliza P.
San Jacintor, pursor of the. (1) n.d.
Whipple, E. K. (1) May 3to Mrs. GHP.
Wyman, Charles. (8) 1873 - 1874,to Mrs. GHP, Mrs. EMP.
Peele, Hubbell and Co. Printed press book, with enclosed business circulars.
Peirce, George H. Correspondence copybook and abstracts of incoming Peele, Hubbell and Co. mail; diary.
Book of pro forma invoices and price computation tables.
I. Contains a few letters and bible verses learned by young George J. Peirce
I. Recipes; II. Expense accounts; III. Verse. IV, Misc. Notes
Mercantile Review (English and Spanish). multiple copies 10/31/1873; 11/14/1873; 11/28/1873; 12/12/1873.
Student Visa issued to George P. Peirce, 1893.
1. English High School Association, Boston, Massachusetts. Life Membership certificate, May 1, 1872.
2. Oversize photo albums; two of Manila and Philippines; one of HongKong, Canton, Macao, Peking.
5. Portrait of woman, in gilt frame.

note.p: in MSS Division (for use of desk)
